publicationStmt.publisher: Uppsala University, Department of linguistics and philology

msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Exodus 10
ab.l:
And the Lord said to Moses,
‘Come to Pharaoh, because I have hardened
his heart and the heart of his servants for the purpose of my setting
these my signs of mine in the midst of them,

And for the purpose
that you may tell in the ears of your son, and of your son’s
son, what I have done wonders in Egypt and my signs
which I have set among them, and that you may know that I am the Lord.’

And Moses and Aaron came to Pharaoh, and said
to him, ‘Thus said the Lord God of the Hebrews, “How long
will you not want to break yourself before me? Let my people go, so that they
may serve me.

Because if you are not willing to let
my people go, lo, at daybreak I will bring locust
in your border.

And they will cover the face of the earth, and
one will not be able to see the earth. And they will eat the
residue of that which is escaped, which remained to you from the hail, and will eat
every tree which grows for you from the field.

And your houses will fill up, and the houses of all your servants,
and the houses of all the Egyptians, which your fathers, or your fathers’
fathers did not see from the times that they were on the earth to this
day.”’ And he turned, and went out from before Pharaoh.

And Pharaoh’s servants said to him, ‘How long
shall this be a snare to us? Let those men go, and
may they serve the Lord their own God.
Do you want to learn that Egypt is destroyed before you let them go?’

And Moses and Aaron turned to Pharaoh,
and he said to them, ‘Go, serve the Lord
your God. But who will be they that shall go?’

And Moses said, ‘We will go with our children and with our old,
with our sons and with our daughters, we will go with our flocks and
with our cattle, because we are obliged to hold a feast to the Lord’

And he said to them, ‘Let the
Lord’s help be so with you when I will let you
and your young ones go, see, because evil is before you.

Not so! Go now, you, young men, and serve
the Lord, because you wanted this.’ And he drove them out from
before Pharaoh.

And the Lord said to Moses,
‘Reach out your hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts,
and it shall come up on the land of Egypt, and it shall eat every
plant of the land, all that the hail has left.’

And Moses reached out his staff over the land
of Egypt, and the Lord drove an east wind on the land all that day
and all the night. It was morning, and the east wind
brought the locusts.

And the locusts went up
over all the land of Egypt and lingered
in all the borders of Egypt, very strong: before it there were no
such locusts like it, and after them there will not be such.

And they covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened,
and they ate every plant of the land, and all the
fruit of the trees which the hail had left. And there remained not any green
thing in the trees, or in the plants of the field, in all the land
of Egypt.

And Pharaoh hurried to call for Moses
and Aaron, and he said, ‘I have sinned against the Lord your God,
and against you.

And now, forgive
my sin only this once, and pray to the Lord your
God, that he may take from me just this death away.’

And he went out from before Pharaoh, and prayed to
the Lord.

And the Lord turned back a
very strong west wind, and took away the locusts,
and drove them into the Red Sea. Not one locust was left
in all the border of Egypt.

But the Lord hardened
Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not let the children
of Israel go.

And the Lord said to Moses, ‘Reach out
your hand toward the skies, that there may be darkness over the land
of Egypt, even darkness which may be touched.’

And Moses reached out
his hand toward the skies, and there was a foggy darkness
in all the land of Egypt three days.

They did not see
one another, neither rose any from his place for three
days. But all the children of Israel had light in their
places of dwelling.

And Pharaoh called to Moses, and said,
‘Go, serve the Lord, only let your flocks and your cattle
be left. Your little ones shall go with you as well.’

And
Moses said, ‘You must give us also sacrifices and
burnt offerings, so we will do them to the Lord our God.

And
our livestock will go with us as well. Not a hoof will be left,
because of them we will take to serve the Lord our God,
and we do not know with what kind of sacrifice we will serve
the Lord, until we come there.’

But
the Lord hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not want to let
them go.

And Moses said, ‘You have spoken the truth,
I will not see your face again.’
